result.execSummary:
The defendant Cody S. Grubba was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Cody S. Grubba is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Cody S. Grubba was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Cody S. Grubba was found guilty of Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

May serve all but the first 45 days on home monitoring program if qualify after an assessment is done.

miscConds.notes: Pay restitution Joint and Several with co-defendants Joseph Olszewski and Jordan Feltz in the amount of $158.00.

Submit DNA Sample.
Do not possess any firearms during term of probation.
Participate in other counseling/assessments as recommended by the agent.
Eligible for early discharge of probation if successfully completed and with recommendation of the agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cody S. Grubba

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: for Early Discharge from Probation Pursuant to 973.09(3)(d) /s/ TBE 04/04/17

Defendant Cody S. Grubba in court with attorney Maris Rushevics. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard are 15CF-270 and 15CF-385.

9:06 AM Court calls cases.
Atty Cousins states appearances.

Address is verified.

There is a plea agreement.
15CF-270: Defendant is pleading to Count 2 and Count 3. Count 1 being dismissed.
15CF-385: Dismissed and read in.

This is a joint recommendation.

Atty Rushevics concurs, unclear about the community service request.
Defendant concurs.

Parties can argue about the community service.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST Count 2.
Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST Count 3.

Court questions Defendant regarding pleas.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Rushevics for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 1: Dismissed Outright
Count 2: Found Guilty Disorderly Conduct
Count 3: Found Guilty Criminal Damage to Property
15CF-385: Dismissed and Read In

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court, requests 100 hours of community service
Atty Rushevics makes sentencing arguments to the Court, requests hours of community service waived.
Defendant addresses the Court.

Court believes the plea agreement is fair and appropriate.

BY THE COURT:
Count 2:
Jail sentence of 90 Days, Imposed and Stayed
Huber granted for work, counseling and any other reason the sheriff will allow, if revoked
May serve all but the first 45 days on home monitoring program if qualify after an assessment is done
2 days Jail Credit
Probation for a period of 18 Months
Conditions:
Perform 30 hours of community service, recommended with the Portage County Parks Department
Pay costs
Pay restitution Joint and Several with co-defendants Joseph Olszewski and Jordan Feltz in the amount of $158
Pay DNA Surcharge
Submit DNA Sample
Do not possess any firearms during term of probation
Participate in other counseling/assessments as recommended by the agent
Eligible for early discharge of probation if successfully completed and with recommendation of the agent

Count 3:
Jail sentence of 180 Days, Imposed and Stayed, concurrent to Count 2
Huber granted for work, counseling and any other reason the sheriff will allow, if revoked
May serve all but the first 45 days on home monitoring program if qualify after an assessment is done
2 days Jail Credit
Probation for a period of 18 Months, concurrent to Count 2
Conditions:
Comply with conditions of probation as stated in Count 2
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
Eligible for early discharge of probation if successfully completed and with recommendation of the agent

$500 cash bond to be applied to fine/costs from the read in charge.

Court will not order the gun forfeited.

8:56 a.m. Defendant Cody S. Grubba in court with attorney Maris Rushevics. Defendant Cody S. Grubba in custody. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.

Defendant Cody S. Grubba in court with attorney Maris Rushevics. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
Time limits waived.
Bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 31, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

$1,000 cash bond: Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.  Do not possess any firearms or other dangerous weapons.

1:32 p.m.
DA case #15PT1336
d.o.b. 04-07-1993
ADA Cousins  appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.
ADA Cousins  states facts for anticipated charges of Discharge Firearm from Vehicle, Bail Jump.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs Defendant right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.
Court questions Defendant. 
State requests a $1,000 cash bond  with conditions as stated.

BTC: $1,000 cash bond: Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.  Do not possess any firearms or other dangerous weapons.

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:  07-27-15  @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 2
